other_tests.findings: Normal background and generalized high-voltage bursts of spike-wave and polyspike discharges at a rate of 3 per second.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Discharges were more prominent with hyperventilation and photic stimulation, with a frequency of 1 to 2 per second.

other_tests.findings: Weaknesses in the domains of language, attention, executive functioning, and memory.
No evidence of lysosomal storage disease.
Mild cerebral and cerebellar atrophy and mild periventricular hyperintensities.
Generalized background slowing during brief wakefulness and bifrontal spikes during sleep, without associated clinical symptoms.
Massive accumulation of lipofuscin in virtually all neurons of the central nervous system; diagnostic of adult-type neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis (Kufsâ€™ disease).
